title: Disinfection
description: Ozonation provides deep disinfection of premises and transport, destroying bacteria, viruses, fungi and spores without chemical residues. The gas penetrates all hard-to-reach areas.

offices.title: Office premises
offices.content:
The office is the face of the company. Polluted air with unpleasant odors harms staff, reduces productivity and loyalty, and damages the company's image with clients and partners.

In most buildings, concentrations of toxic substances in the air are 2–5 times higher than outdoors. Benzene, formaldehyde and ammonia are released from furniture, carpets, office equipment and finishes. Ozonation effectively neutralizes these pollutants.

Ozone disinfects everything staff and visitors touch: desktops, armrests, office equipment, coffee machines. It reduces virus transmission via surfaces, removes odors and freshens the air.

Treatment is run at night on a timer. 1–2 hours of ozonation is usually enough. Ozone generator capacity: about 1 g/h per 25 m³ of room volume. By the time staff arrive, ozone has dissipated, leaving a light fresh smell.
benefits: Removal of toxic substances from air

pollution.label: Pollution
pollution.description: Office air is dirtier than outdoor air

intro.text: The office is the face of the company. Polluted air with unpleasant odors harms staff, reduces productivity and loyalty, and damages the company's image with clients and partners.
intro.text2: Scientists have found that in most buildings, concentrations of harmful and toxic chemicals in the air are 2–5 times higher than outdoors. In some offices, indoor air pollution levels for certain toxins are up to 70 times higher than outside.

highlight1.title: Sources of office air pollution:
highlight1.text: benzene, formaldehyde, and ammonia are released from furniture, carpets, office equipment, and finishes. Traditional ventilation and air conditioning strip the air of its natural freshness.

airQuality.title: The problem of air quality in offices
airQuality.text: Air loses its 'freshness' after passing through air conditioners and heating systems. As a result, ozone and ion levels drop by 90%. The lack of these natural air components has led to complaints of frequent headaches, weakness, and poor well-being — 'sick building syndrome'.
items: Benzene — from paints, carpets, curtains, and furniture upholstery
Ammonia — from tobacco smoke and cleaning products
Formaldehyde — from plywood, furniture, particleboard, office partitions
Trichloroethylene — from paint, glue, furniture, and wallpaper
Chloroform — from paints, carpets, and curtains

effectiveness.title: Effectiveness of ozonation
effectiveness.text: Studies have shown that adding ozone to air at 15 parts per billion (0.03 mg/m³) produces an effect equivalent to a two-hour walk in fresh air. Staff showed strengthened immune systems, increased blood oxygen levels, and improved blood pressure.

whatDisinfects.title: What ozone disinfects in the office
whatDisinfects.text: Ozone disinfects all surfaces touched by staff and visitors. The gas penetrates crevices and hard-to-reach areas behind equipment and into ventilation systems.

treatmentMode.title: Office treatment mode
treatmentMode.text: Ozonation of offices and coworking spaces is conducted at night. Equipment runs automatically on a timer. By the time staff arrive, ozone has dissipated, leaving a light fresh smell.

steps.title: Room preparation
steps.description: Close all windows and doors. Turn off supply ventilation. Ensure no one is in the room.

steps.title: Starting the ozonator
steps.description: Turn on the ozonator for 40–120 minutes depending on room volume. Capacity: 1 g/h per 25 m³.

steps.title: Exposure
steps.description: Ozone spreads throughout the room, penetrating all crevices and far corners. Concentration reaches the required level.

steps.title: Ventilation
steps.description: 2–3 hours after treatment ends, ozone decomposes to safe levels. Active ventilation is not required.

toiletOdor.title: Toilet odor elimination
toiletOdor.text: Toilet odor is one of the most common problems in office buildings. Causes can vary: leaky pipe connections, ventilation 'backflow', uric acid stone formation.

highlight.text: To eliminate toilet odor, install an ozonator with capacity of 0.5 g/h for 24/7 ozonation or 5 g/h for night treatment. Ozone breaks down odorous organic compounds into simple odorless compounds.

Ventilation is not required after night treatment
Staff opening the room after treatment use respirators

public-transport.title: Public transport
public-transport.shortDesc: Disinfection of buses, trams and trolleybuses
public-transport.content:
Public transport is a high-risk environment for infection transmission. Ozonation allows quick and effective disinfection of bus, tram and trolleybus interiors between runs or at night.

Ozone disinfects everything passengers touch: handrails, seats, windows and walls. The gas penetrates all crevices and hard-to-reach areas for full interior treatment. Odors and mold growth are also suppressed.

Treatment: 20–40 minutes depending on interior volume. After treatment, ventilate for 20 minutes or use the vehicle's ventilation system to clear ozone.

Equipment can run from the vehicle's power (12V or 24V). No staff need to stay — turn on the generator and leave. No consumables reduce operating costs.

sports-facilities.title: Sports facilities
sports-facilities.shortDesc: Disinfection of halls and locker rooms
sports-facilities.content:
Gyms, fitness centers and locker rooms are high-risk for infection spread and have specific odors. Ozonation addresses both: it disinfects equipment and removes sweat odor.

Ozone destroys bacteria, viruses, mold, fungi and parasitic protozoa on equipment, stands, benches and mats. The gas penetrates material pores for deep disinfection.

Sports facilities are treated at night. 2–3 hours at about 1 g/h per 25 m³ is typical. For large halls and arenas, mobile ozone generators of 60–120 g/h are used.

After the generator is off, ozone drops to safe levels in 2–3 hours. Only a light fresh smell remains. Staff should not enter during treatment.

intro.paragraph1: Gyms, fitness centers and locker rooms are high-risk for infection spread and have specific odors. Ozonation addresses both: it disinfects equipment and completely removes sweat odor, rather than masking it.
intro.paragraph2: Ozone destroys bacteria, viruses, mold, fungi and parasitic protozoa on equipment, stands, benches and mats. The gas penetrates material pores for deep disinfection of textiles and soft surfaces.

warning.title: Fungal infections
warning.text: are one of the main problems in sports facilities. Athlete's foot, ringworm, candidiasis are transmitted through shared locker rooms, showers and sports equipment. Ozone destroys fungal spores on all surfaces.

odorProblem.title: Odor problem in gyms
odorProblem.text: Sweat odor in gyms is the result of bacterial activity on human skin. Regular cleaning and air fresheners only mask the problem. Ozone breaks down odor molecules and destroys the bacteria that produce them.

process.title: Sports facility treatment mode
process.text: Sports facilities are treated at night when closed to visitors. For large halls and arenas, powerful mobile ozone generators of 60–120 g/h are used.

steps.title: Room preparation
steps.description: Close all windows and doors. Turn off supply ventilation. Ensure no one is in the hall.

steps.title: Ozone generator placement
steps.description: Wall-mounted generator — at least 3 m high. Mobile — at maximum height, e.g., on a referee's platform.

steps.title: Ozonation
steps.description: Run the generator for 2–3 hours. Capacity: 1 g/h per 25 m³ of room volume.

steps.title: Ozone decay
steps.description: After the generator stops, concentration drops to safe levels in 2–3 hours. A light fresh smell remains.

highlight.title: Calculation formula:
highlight.text: 1 g/h ozone capacity per 25 m³ of room volume. For rooms with high contamination or large surface area, increase capacity by 20–30%.

shopping-malls.title: Shopping malls
shopping-malls.content:
Shopping malls are high-traffic spaces with dense visitor flow. Ozonation maintains air quality, removes odors and helps prevent infection spread.

Regular ozone treatment during off-hours disinfects all surfaces: escalators, handrails, elevators, benches, restrooms. The gas reaches all areas, including back-of-house and technical zones.

Ozone effectively removes odors from food courts, restrooms and storage areas. It neutralizes chemical pollutants from finishes and merchandise. The air becomes fresh and pleasant for visitors.

Large malls use high-capacity industrial ozone generators or systems integrated with ventilation. Treatment is automated with timers and sensors.
